title: How to Stretch a Piercing

steps.headline: Be sure you've washed your hands with antibacterial soap before touching the jewelry or the fistula (piercing hole)
Stretch one size at a time.
steps.description: Sizes go down in number, by two's (for example, 12g to 10g, etc). You will regret it if you do not as you will cause scar tissue and a blowout.

steps.headline: Use a water based lubricant or a specialized stretching oil.
steps.description: Do not use vaseline or anything else that will clog up the piercing and trap bacteria. (Do NOT use Neosporin!)

steps.headline: Never use acrylic/silicone/kaos/collapsible plugs or tunnels to stretch, they will irritate your piercing and more often than not tear your ear.
Use a taper to stretch the piercing.
Soak the area with sea salt to draw out any possible infections.

tyn: Body jewelry one size larger than your current jewelry.
Lubricant, preferably vitamin E, emu, or jojoba oil.
text: Be sure you've washed your hands with antibacterial soap before touching the jewelry or the fistula (piercing hole)  Stretch one size at a time. Sizes go down in number, by two's (for example, 12g to 10g, etc). You will regret it if you do not as you will cause scar tissue and a blowout. Use a water based lubricant or a specialized stretching oil. Do not use vaseline or anything else that will clog up the piercing and trap bacteria. (Do NOT use Neosporin!) Never use acrylic/silicone/kaos/collapsible plugs or tunnels to stretch, they will irritate your piercing and more often than not tear your ear.  Use a taper to stretch the piercing.  Soak the area with sea salt to draw out any possible infections.

Sizes go down in number, by two's (for example, 12g to 10g, etc).
You will regret it if you do not as you will cause scar tissue and a blowout.
Use a water based lubricant or a specialized stretching oil.
Do not use vaseline or anything else that will clog up the piercing and trap bacteria.
Never use acrylic/silicone/kaos/collapsible plugs or tunnels to stretch, they will irritate your piercing and more often than not tear your ear.
Use a taper to stretch the piercing.
Soak the area with sea salt to draw out any possible infections.
